com.ibm.team.process.common
Interface IProcessArea

All Superinterfaces:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, IAuditable, IAuditableHandle, IItem, IItemHandle, IManagedItem, IManagedItemHandle, INamed, IProcessAreaHandle, IProcessContainer, IProcessContainerHandle, IProcessItem, IProcessItemHandle
All Known Subinterfaces:
IProjectArea, ITeamArea
public interface IProcessArea
extends IProcessAreaHandle, IProcessContainer, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable

Common interface for project and team areas.

Since:
0.5

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this area. If the area is a project area, the name is unique among the set of existing project areas. If the area is a team area the name is unique among all team areas at the same level of the team area hierarchy of a project area.

In order for this item to be saved to the repository this field must have a non-null value, so it is safe to assume that this method will not return null if it is an immutable copy fetched from the repository. It is possible for an incomplete/invalid working copy, however, to return null.

Specified by:
getName in interface INamed
Returns:
the area name or null
See Also:
INamed.getName()

getMembers

IContributorHandle[] getMembers()
Returns an array of handles representing the contributors constituting the team members of this process area.

Returns:
the team members of this process area

hasMember

boolean hasMember(IContributorHandle contributorHandle)
Returns true if the contributor represented by the given handle is a member of this team, false otherwise.

Parameters:
contributorHandle - a handle to the contributor for which to check membership
Returns:
true if the contributor is a member, false otherwise

addMember

void addMember(IContributorHandle contributorHandle)
Adds the contributor represented by the given handle to the set of contributors constituting the members of this process area. If the given contributor is already a member of this process area, this method does not have any effect.

Parameters:
contributorHandle - a handle to the contributor to be added to the process area

removeMember

void removeMember(IContributorHandle contributorHandle)
Removes the contributor represented by the given handle from the set of contributors constituting the members of this process area. If the given contributor is not a member of this process area, this method does not have any effect.

Parameters:
contributorHandle - a handle to the contributor to be removed from the process area

removeAllMembers

void removeAllMembers()
Removes all contributors from this team area.

getTeamData

ITeamData getTeamData()
Returns the team data associated with the process area.

Returns:
the team data associated with this process area

getProjectArea

IProjectAreaHandle getProjectArea()
Returns a handle to the project area which contains this process area or null. In case this process area is a project area the returned handle is a handle to the project area itself.

In order for this item to be saved to the repository this field must have a non-null value, so it is safe to assume that this method will not return null if it is an immutable copy fetched from the repository. It is possible for an incomplete/invalid working copy, however, to return null.

Returns:
a handle to the project area which contains this process area or null

getAdministrators

IContributorHandle[] getAdministrators()
Returns the collection of users who are responsible for administering the process area.

Returns:
the collection of users who are responsible for administering this process area
Since:
0.6

hasAdministrator

boolean hasAdministrator(IContributorHandle contributorHandle)
Returns true if the contributor represented by the given handle is an administrator of this team, false otherwise.

Parameters:
contributorHandle - a handle to the contributor for which to check administrator membership
Returns:
true if the contributor is an administrator, false otherwise

addAdministrator

void addAdministrator(IContributorHandle contributorHandle)
Adds the contributor represented by the given handle to the set of contributors constituting the administrators of this process area. If the given contributor is already an administrator of this process area, this method does not have any effect.

Parameters:
contributorHandle - a handle to the contributor to be added as an administrator of the process area

removeAdministrator

void removeAdministrator(IContributorHandle contributorHandle)
Removes the contributor represented by the given handle from the set of contributors constituting the administrators of this process area. If the given contributor is not an administrator of this process area, this method does not have any effect.

Parameters:
contributorHandle - a handle to the contributor to be removed as an administrator of the process area

setAdministrators

void setAdministrators(IContributorHandle[] administrators)
Sets the collection of users who are responsible for administering the process area.

Parameters:
administrators - the administrators
Since:
0.6

getRoleAssignmentIds

java.lang.String[] getRoleAssignmentIds(IContributorHandle contributor)
Returns the collection of role ids which are assigned to the given contributor in this process area.

Note that this method only returns the roles that are directly assigned in this area. Callers interested in finding the effective set of roles that a user has for a process area (including inheritance) should instead call: com.ibm.team.process.service.IServerProcess#getContributorRoles(IContributorHandle, IProcessArea) or com.ibm.team.process.client.IClientProcess#getContributorRoles(IContributorHandle, IProcessArea, IProgressMonitor)

Parameters:
contributor -
Returns:

getRoleAssignments

IRole[] getRoleAssignments(IContributorHandle contributor,
                           IRole[] availableRoles)
Returns the subset of the given collection of available roles which are assigned to the given contributor in this process area. If there are additional roles assigned in this team area which are not included in the given collection of availableRoles, that data will be ignored.

Callers of this method should compute the set of available roles for this process area by calling either: com.ibm.team.process.service.IServerProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea) or com.ibm.team.process.client.IClientProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea, IProgressMonitor)

Callers interested in retrieving the raw set of role ids assigned to the given contributor in this process area should get getRoleAssignmentIds(...) instead.

Parameters:
contributor - the contributor whose role assignments to return
availableRoles - the set of available roles to consider
Returns:
the subset of the given collection of available roles which are assigned to the given contributor in this process area.

setRoleAssignments

void setRoleAssignments(IContributorHandle contributor,
                        IRole[] roles)
Sets the collection of roles assigned to the given contributor.

Roles passed into this method should be a subset of available roles for this process area retrieved by calling either: com.ibm.team.process.service.IServerProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea) or com.ibm.team.process.client.IClientProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea, IProgressMonitor)

Parameters:
contributor - the contributor whose roles to assign
roles - the roles to assign

addRoleAssignments

void addRoleAssignments(IContributorHandle contributor,
                        IRole[] roles)
Appends the given roles to the collection of roles assigned to the given contributor.

If any of the given roles are already assigned to the given contributor, those roles will be ignored. Callers wishing to reorder role assignments should call setRoleAssignments(...) instead.

Roles passed into this method should be a subset of available roles for this process area retrieved by calling either: com.ibm.team.process.service.IServerProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea) or com.ibm.team.process.client.IClientProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea, IProgressMonitor)

Parameters:
contributor - the contributor whose roles to assign
roles - the roles to append

removeRoleAssignments

void removeRoleAssignments(IContributorHandle contributor,
                           IRole[] rolesToRemove)
Removes the given roles from the collection of roles assigned to the given contributor.

If any of the given roles are not assigned to the given contributor, those roles will be ignored.

Roles passed into this method should be a subset of available roles for this process area retrieved by calling either: com.ibm.team.process.service.IServerProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea) or com.ibm.team.process.client.IClientProcess#getRoles(IProcessArea, IProgressMonitor)

Parameters:
contributor - the contributor whose roles to remove
roles - the roles to remove

getContextId

UUID getContextId(IAccessGroup.ReadAccessContextType contextType)
Retrieves the context id for the specified read access context type.

Parameters:
contextType - the read access context of interest
Returns:
the context id for the specified read access context type, or null if it hasn't been set
